summary: We found that the Departments of the Interior and Treasury faced challenges distributing over $8 billion in certain CARES Act funds for tribes. Also, Treasury's formula for allocating some of the funds used certain population data without consulting with tribes about the data's limitations. Consultation could have allowed Treasury to address affected tribes' concerns prior to making payments—avoiding subsequent litigation and delayed payments to these...
title: COVID-19: Lessons Learned from Interior and Treasury's Administration of CARES Act Funds Could Improve Federal Emergency Relief to Tribes
